rows.translation: The Reality!

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.

rows.translation: What is the Reality?
Ah, what will convey unto thee what the reality is!
(The tribes of) Thamud and A'ad disbelieved in the judgment to come.
As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the lightning.

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
rows.translation: And as for A'ad, they were destroyed by a fierce roaring wind,

rows.arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَـٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
rows.translation: Which He imposed on them for seven long nights and eight long days so that thou mightest have seen men lying overthrown, as they were hollow trunks of palm-trees.
rows.transliteration: sakhharahā `alayhim sab`a layālin wathamāniyata ayyāmin ḥusūman fataral qawma fīhā ṣar`ā ka-annahum a`jāzu nakhlin khāwiyah

rows.translation: Canst thou (O Muhammad) see any remnant of them?

rows.arabic: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
rows.translation: And Pharaoh and those before him, and the communities that were destroyed, brought error,
rows.transliteration: wajā-a fir`awnu wa man qablahu wal mu-tafikātu bil khāṭi-ah

rows.arabic: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
rows.translation: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, therefor did He grip them with a tightening grip.
rows.transliteration: fa`aṣaw rasūla rabbihim fa-akhadhahum akhdhatan rābiyah

rows.arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَـٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ
rows.translation: Lo! when the waters rose, We carried you upon the ship
rows.transliteration: innā lammā ṭaghal mā-u ḥamalnākum fil jāriyah

rows.arabic: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌ وَٰعِيَةٌ
rows.translation: That We might make it a memorial for you, and that remembering ears (that heard the story) might remember.
rows.transliteration: linaj`alahā lakum tadhkiratan wata`iyahā udhunun wā`iyah

rows.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ
rows.translation: And when the trumpet shall sound one blast
rows.transliteration: fa-idhā nufikha fiṣ ṣūri nafkhatun wāḥidah

rows.arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَٰحِدَةً
rows.translation: And the earth with the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed with one crash,
rows.transliteration: waḥumilatil-arḍu wal jibālu fadukkatā dakkatan wāḥidah

rows.translation: Then, on that day will the Event befall.
And the heaven will split asunder, for that day it will be frail.

rows.arabic: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَـٰنِيَةٌ
rows.translation: And the angels will be on the sides thereof, and eight will uphold the Throne of thy Lord that day, above them.
rows.transliteration: wal malaku `alā arjā-ihā ۚ wayaḥmilu `arsha rabbika fawqahum yawma-idhin thamāniyah

rows.arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
rows.translation: On that day ye will be exposed; not a secret of you will be hidden.
rows.transliteration: yawma-idhin tu`raḍūna lā takhfā minkum khāfiyah

rows.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
rows.translation: Then, as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say: Take, read my book!
rows.transliteration: fa-ammā man ūtiya kitābahu biyamīnihi fayaqūlu hā-umuq-ra-ū kitābiyah

rows.translation: Surely I knew that I should have to meet my reckoning.
Then he will be in blissful state
In a high garden
Whereof the clusters are in easy reach.

rows.arabic: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ
rows.translation: (And it will be said unto those therein): Eat and drink at ease for that which ye sent on before you in past days.
rows.transliteration: kulū washrabū hanī-an bimā aslaftum fil-ayyāmil khāliyah

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
rows.translation: But as for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say: Oh, would that I had not been given my book
rows.transliteration: wa-ammā man ūtiya kitābahu bishimālihi fayaqūlu yālaytanī lam ūta kitābiyah

rows.translation: And knew not what my reckoning!
Oh, would that it had been death!
My wealth hath not availed me,
My power hath gone from me.
(It will be said): Take him and fetter him
And then expose him to hell-fire

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ
rows.translation: And then insert him in a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits.
rows.transliteration: thumma fī silsilatin dhar`uhā sab`ūna dhirā`an faslukūh

rows.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
rows.translation: Lo! He used not to believe in Allah the Tremendous,
And urged not on the feeding of the wretched.
Therefor hath he no lover here this day,
Nor any food save filth
Which none but sinners eat.
But nay! I swear by all that ye see
And all that ye see not
That it is indeed the speech of an illustrious messenger.

rows.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: It is not poet's speech - little is it that ye believe!
rows.transliteration: wa mā huwa biqawli shā`ir ۚ qalīlan mā tu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: Nor diviner's speech - little is it that ye remember!
rows.transliteration: walā biqawli kāhin ۚ qalīlan mā tadhakkarūn

rows.translation: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
And if he had invented false sayings concerning Us,
We assuredly had taken him by the right hand
And then severed his life-artery,

rows.arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَـٰجِزِينَ
rows.translation: And not one of you could have held Us off from him.
And lo! it is a warrant unto those who ward off (evil).
And lo! We know that some among you will deny (it).
rows.transliteration: wa innā lana`lamu anna minkum mukadhhibīn

rows.translation: And lo! it is indeed an anguish for the disbelievers.
And lo! it is absolute truth.
So glorify the name of thy Tremendous Lord.
